Ooc:  He was attempting to bipass the satellite so he could see if that had=
 a y reprogramming done to it via direct mainframe interface.

Bic:  Nights=
hift narrows his eyes and gets closer to the screen.

" Hmm, a reset, I don=
't think any of us reset this station so whoever did, knew how ta cover the=
ir tracks.   Okay, Computer, list ID and ID number of the programmer who in=
itiated the reset on corosponding Date of alteration."

He turns to Polar C=
law and the others.

"I used ta help in diagnostics once in a while on Cybe=
rtron.  And even if everything looked normal, didn't mean that there wasn't=
 a change somewhere.  I got a feeling we have a back door Trojan somewhere =
and if there was a reset somewhere, that means there could be a hacker.  Gr=
rrr, if I find out who that is, they're as good as scrap metal."




Don't =
be envious of what you don't have, be grateful for things you already posse=
s.  Nothing is worth more than family and friends.

On Dec 26, 2011, at 5:5=
6 AM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

> > <OLD>
> >
> > Ni=
ghtshift looks at the computer module and sits in front of it.
> >
> > " I =
know. Computer, identify all alterations in your configuration and
> > iden=
tify the programmer. Bypass all satellite channels and convert ta in
> > ho=
use text panels . "
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> "Working." The computer responded. "Com=
munication Systems Protocol has
> been recently reset. No alterations detec=
ted." The computer returned
> after a moment.
> 
> OOC: Not sure what Night=
hift meant there, unless he meant: for the
> computer to ignore satellite? =
But I responded to the rest.
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> - Preston
> 

--Apple-Mail-755B2B3E-75C3-425C-B24F-7E9DA43F4C22
